metatags.og:description: Local ordinances generally may not supersede the MCL unless specified in state statute. Is a bicycle considered a vehicle in Michigan? No. MCL 257.79 defines a “vehicle” as: “every device in, upon, or by which any person or property is or may be transported or drawn upon a highway, except devices exclusively moved by human
